cdf:Benchmark.cdf:title: XCCDF Sample for Cisco IOS
cdf:Benchmark.cdf:description: This document defines a small set of rules for securing Cisco IOS routers. The set of rules constitute a benchmark. A benchmark usually represents an industry consensus of best practices. It lists steps to be taken as well as rationale for them. This example benchmark is merely a small subset of the rules that would be necessary for securing an IOS router.
cdf:Benchmark.cdf:notice: This sample may be freely copied and used, at least for now.

cdf:front-matter.htm:p: This benchmark assumes that you are running IOS 11.3 or later.

cdf:Benchmark.cdf:reference: NSA Router Security Configuration Guide, Version 1.1b

cdf:Value.cdf:title: IOS - line exec timeout value
cdf:Value.cdf:description: The length of time, in minutes, that an interactive session should be allowed to stay idle before being terminated.
cdf:Value.cdf:question: Session exec timeout time (in minutes)

cdf:Group.cdf:title: Management Plane Rules
cdf:Group.cdf:description: Services, settings, and data streams related tosetting up and examining the static configuration of the router, and the authentication and authorization of administrators/operators.

cdf:Rule.cdf:title: IOS - no IP finger service
cdf:Rule.cdf:description: Disable the finger service, it can reveal information about logged in users to unauthorized parties.
cdf:Rule.cdf:question: Prohibit the finger service

cdf:Rule.cdf:title: Require exec timeout on admin sessions
cdf:Rule.cdf:description: Configure each administrative access line to terminate idle sessions after a fixed period of time determined by local policy
cdf:Rule.cdf:question: Require admin session idle timeout

cdf:Group.cdf:title: Control Plane Rules
cdf:Group.cdf:description: Services, settings, and data streams that support the operation and dynamic status of the router.
cdf:Group.cdf:question: Check rules related to system control

cdf:Value.cdf:title: Logging level for buffered logging
cdf:Value.cdf:description: Logging level for buffered logging; this setting is a severity level. Every audit message of this severity or more (worse) will be logged.
cdf:Value.cdf:question: Select a buffered logging level

cdf:Rule.cdf:title: Disable tcp-small-servers
cdf:Rule.cdf:description: Disable unnecessary services such as echo, chargen, etc.
cdf:Rule.cdf:question: Prohibit TCP small services
cdf:Rule.cdf:fixtext: Disable TCP small servers in IOS global config mode.

cdf:Rule.cdf:title: Disable udp-small-servers
cdf:Rule.cdf:description: Disable unnecessary UDP services such as echo, chargen, etc.
cdf:Rule.cdf:question: Forbid UDP small services
cdf:Rule.cdf:fixtext: Disable UDP small servers in IOS global config mode.

cdf:Rule.cdf:title: Set the buffered logging level
cdf:Rule.cdf:description: Set the buffered logging level to one of the appropriate levels, Warning or higher. Log level should be set explicitly.
cdf:Rule.cdf:question: Check the buffered logging level

cdf:Group.cdf:title: Data Plane Level 1
cdf:Group.cdf:description: Services and settings related to the data passing through the router (as opposed to directed to it). Basically, the data plane is for everything not in control or mgmt planes.
cdf:Group.cdf:question: Check rules related to data flow

cdf:Group.cdf:title: Routing Rules
cdf:Group.cdf:description: Rules in this group affect traffic forwarded through the router, including router actions taken on receipt of special data traffic.
cdf:Group.cdf:question: Apply standard forwarding protections

cdf:Rule.cdf:title: IOS - no directed broadcasts
cdf:Rule.cdf:description: Disable IP directed broadcast on each interface.
cdf:Rule.cdf:question: Forbid IP directed broadcast
cdf:Rule.cdf:fixtext: Disable IP directed broadcast on each interface using IOS interface configuration mode.
